urlLink http://www.theooze.com/articles/article.cfm?id=876 I read that article over at the ooze today. It struck me as being so true and appropriate. I'm currently reading through the purpose driven life with my wife Mel and on day 16 it's all about time. I realized as I read that my time is so valuable and often I waste alot of it on just surfing the net or other meaningless activities when I could be loving my wife or serving someone. You know? urlLink TallSkinnyKiwi: House Churches Have No Sex Appeal Holy Cow!! I just read Andrew's rant in it's entirety and although much of it I still need to process point 5 was golden. What I am trying to process right now is whether there is a way to do a postmodern ministry in partnership with the mega-church I currently attend. It is disturbing to me that I've heard people call the way we do church currently "crap". So the bride of Christ is crap? If you said that about my wife I'd beat you down right there and then. I don't question that church has to change. I also don't question that God has been working through his church all this time. It's not like God hasn't been in control of every evolution of the church since the dawn of time. Thanks Andrew for your thoughts.

urlLink richardwhite I'm not sure that this whole argument against consumer based Christianity is completely valid. If you were to ask the leaders of these churches I think they'd say they were trying to be effective to a certain mindset and generation....culturally relevant. When people have that language so engrained in their heads why not speak that language to increase ministry effectiveness. The emerging church could really just be doing the same. I know that we have this focus on daily living and such but I think if you asked any pastor at any mega church they think that is what they are doing through their small groups. Are we simply offering another kind of worship (smaller. more intimate and not focused around music) or are we truly doing church differently? The tendancy in us is to see someone with an older view as inferior but we have to constantly be checking ourselves that we aren't simply following the same footsteps and convincing ourselves they've never been seen before.

Perhaps this will be a long lived, fruitful blog or, more than likely, it'll fade into oblivion some day. Never the less, here is my first post/blog/thought? I'm not even sure what the lingo is in this blog world. I do know that I am on a journey and that I want to document it. So here I am wrestling with what my life is supposed to look like and all of you can get a glimpse into the inner workings of my mind. God help you all. I want to state for my own sake that this blog is intended to help me sort out how I feel about emerging church and what my role may or may not be in that. Over time I'll try and articulate how I got where I am and let you all know where I am headed. For now, let's keep it short and to the point. God is doing something in my life (and my wife's as well). I am committed to discovering that. That's all I know for sure.

as i was waking up this morning something struck me as odd. i have my alarm set to 88.9 shine fm and i heard this thing they have called the "church link". essentially, churches pay the radio station to be able to have a 30 second blurb about their church. one church says "looking for a relational church? i'm pastor kelly, come to the meeting place sunday's at 10:30am." you know, the more i get to know about missional churches and emerging christianity and the more i am drawn to those things, the more i hate hearing stuff like this. i know i am ranting a bit but bear with me. is this what church has become? a 10 second blurb is suppose to get me out to church? i am truly not into the consumerism anymore. i simply want to be church and a follower of CHRIST. i wish the radio station would pull these silly advertisements.
